Returns: A Path along which the points should be interpolated. The returned Path must start at point (startX, startY), typically using @B_android#graphics#Path#moveTo_E@ and end at (endX, endY).
Parameters: float: The x coordinate of the starting point.
float: The y coordinate of the starting point.
float: The x coordinate of the ending point.
float: The y coordinate of the ending point.
getPath(float, float, float, float).Description: Provide a Path to interpolate between two points (startX, startY) and (endX, endY). This allows controlled curved motion along two dimensions.
getPath(float, float, float, float).FullName: public abstract Path getPath (float startX, float startY, float endX, float endY)

Returns: A Path along which the points should be interpolated. The returned Path must start at point (startX, startY), typically using @B_android#graphics#Path#moveTo_E@ and end at (endX, endY).
Parameters: float: The x coordinate of the starting point.
float: The y coordinate of the starting point.
float: The x coordinate of the ending point.
float: The y coordinate of the ending point.
getPath(float,float,float,float).Description: Provide a Path to interpolate between two points (startX, startY) and (endX, endY). This allows controlled curved motion along two dimensions.
getPath(float,float,float,float).FullName: public abstract Path getPath (float startX, float startY, float endX, float endY)

ClassDesc: This base class can be extended to provide motion along a Path to Transitions. Transitions such as @B_android#transition#ChangeBounds_E@ move Views, typically in a straight path between the start and end positions. Applications that desire to have these motions move in a curve can change how Views interpolate in two dimensions by extending PathMotion and implementing @B_android#transition#PathMotion#getPath_E@. This may be used in XML as an element inside a transition.
